capability.name: Program Trading
capability.definition: This Service Domain supports a program trading capability where the trading decisions are made based on predefined/programmed rules and policies. Manual oversight and monitoring capabilities are supported as appropriate
capability.role: Program trading covers a broad range of market trading activities, where the trading rules policies driving the trading decisions are automated, likely with some level of human monitoring/oversight as appropriate. This generic Service Domain is intended to support any form of program trading. In practice a bank may find it necessary to 'clone and specialize' the service domain to support different type of program trading it may employ as necessary.
capability.example: A bank operates a program trading facility to rebalance some of its managed customer investment portfolios

key_features.name: Support the set-up and maintenance of a portfolio of traded securities
key_features.description: Enables support the set-up and maintenance of a portfolio of traded securities to support this service domain supports a program trading capability where the trading decisions are made based on predefined/programmed rules and policies
